revised_title: DNA Analysis in Prenatal Diagnosis of Genetic Diseases
tldr: The article discusses the use of recombinant DNA technology in the prevention and diagnosis of genetic diseases, focusing on the prenatal diagnosis of hemoglobinopathies like sickle cell anemia, thalassemia, and their interactions. The authors describe the molecular pathology of these disorders, the role of restriction fragment length polymorphisms (RFLPs) in carrier detection, and the experience with fetal DNA analysis for prenatal diagnosis. They also highlight the importance of understanding phenotype-genotype relationships and the use of RFLPs in the diagnosis of genetic diseases.
